intro: Penstemon plagapineus, commonly known as the Sierra penstemon, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and tubular, two-lipped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Penstemon plagapineus is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
